pronunciation: PARE, [Latin paro; Gr. lame; to mutilate; Heb. to create; to cut off. The primary sense is to thrust or drive, hence to drive off, to separate, to stop by setting or repelling, as in parry, or to drive off or out, as in separating or producing.]

definitions.text:
Pare
1. To the superficial substance extremities thing; shave with sharp instrument; as, pare an apple an orange; pare the nails; pare horse's hoof; pare land agriculture.
2. To diminish little and little.The king began pare little the privilege clergy.When pare followed the thing diminished, the
the objective case; as, pare the nails. When the thing separated the object, pare followed away; as, pare the rind fruit; pare away redundances.
